titles: The merry bag-pipes: the pleasant pastime betwixt a jolly shepherd and a country damsel, on a mid-summers-day in the morning. To the tune of, March Boys, etc. Licensed according to order.
publisher: Printed for C. Bates next door to the Cro[w]n Tavern in West-Smithfield.,
notes: Date and place of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "A shepherd sat him under a thorn ..."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
